step_by_step.explanation: An ionic bond is formed when one atom donates an electron to another, resulting in electrostatic attraction between ions.

problems.final_answer: Ionic bond: electrostatic attraction between oppositely charged ions formed by electron transfer.

step_by_step.explanation: A covalent bond is formed when two atoms share one or more pairs of electrons.

problems.final_answer: Covalent bond: sharing of electron pairs between atoms.

step_by_step.explanation: A metallic bond is the attraction between delocalized electrons and positively charged metal ions.

problems.final_answer: Metallic bond: attraction of delocalized electrons to metal cations.

problems.problem: Explain lattice energy and its significance.

step_by_step.explanation: Lattice energy is the energy released when 1 mole of an ionic solid forms from gaseous ions; higher lattice energy → stronger ionic bond.

problems.final_answer: Lattice energy: energy released during formation of ionic solid; indicates bond strength.

problems.problem: Predict the bond type in NaCl, H₂O, and Mg.
problems.final_answer: NaCl: ionic; H₂O: covalent; Mg: metallic

step_by_step.explanation: Polarity arises when atoms in a covalent bond have different electronegativities, creating a dipole moment.

problems.final_answer: Polarity: uneven electron distribution due to electronegativity difference → dipole moment.

problems.problem: Determine if CO₂ and H₂O are polar or nonpolar.

step_by_step.explanation: Bent molecule, dipoles do not cancel → polar
Atoms tend to gain, lose, or share electrons to achieve 8 electrons in their valence shell (except H, He).

problems.final_answer: Octet rule: atoms seek 8 valence electrons via transfer or sharing.

problems.problem: Draw the Lewis structure of NH₃ and explain its shape.

step_by_step.explanation: N has 5 valence electrons, H has 1 each → N shares with 3 H atoms; 1 lone pair on N
Trigonal pyramidal due to lone pair repulsion

problems.final_answer: NH₃: trigonal pyramidal with 1 lone pair on N

problems.problem: Explain why metals are good conductors of electricity.

step_by_step.explanation: Metallic bonding creates delocalized electrons that can move freely, allowing electrical conductivity.

problems.final_answer: Metals conduct electricity due to delocalized electrons in metallic bonds.
